1233122.content:
(There will be some late-game P5 Spoilers ahead. So fair warning, if you still haven't made it past Late November, turn back)

That time of year had rolled around again. The season that everyone in the medical field, from Chiefs of Medicine to small-time local physicians feared. It was Flu Season.

Now, even though her reputation as a Doctor was no longer challenged by her former director, that doesn't mean Dr. Tae Takemi was any less of a hard worker, especially for a doctor of her persuasion. And now that Flu Season was rearing its ugly head, to say that Takemi was swamped with orders for her medicine would be an understatement. To add to her stress, her "guinea pig" was currently unavailable, since everyone thinks he's dead...now the punk-rock doc had no one at her clinic to assist her with orders in anyway! Ordinarily, this is what interns would be for...but Takami is a back-alley physician, she could never afford those...

Between writing out prescriptions, dealing with the hypochondriacs, dealing with the actual sick people and filling out all the other paperwork she would collect throughout the day....Tae Takemi could barely walk to the subway station in order to make it home, let alone make up the stairs to her apartment. Crashing on the couch at 4 AM was regular occurrence for her. Even if the heavy bags under her eyes somewhat added to her personal Punk aesthetic, Takemi had to admit to herself...she needed a damn break!

Not only was her work schedule, if you can even call a 14 hour day a "scheduled" day, bringing her down, but she's so tired all the time that she easily forgets to do what most people do in a regular evening after work...Eating & Entertainment! Worst of all, her perpetual malaise makes it difficult for finding time for fulfilling her...other needs. Don't be mistaken though, Takemi has tried to satisfy her womanly needs in recent memory, but she just never was able to feel right doing it. There was no pleasure in it anymore.

As Takemi stared at the pitch dark of ceiling her living room, she thought of ways to alleviate her troubles...then it hit her. "I'll just close the clinic for the weekend", she thought. She'd use the excuse of taking a few "personal vacation days", a reason most people in Japan would view as shamelessly lazy. Yes, it'll be lazy of her and somewhat irresponsible as a doctor, but Takemi reasoned that she can't treat people well when she's under all this stress!

Of course, she's not going to take the weekend off just to chill in bed all day, no...she has a plan. But first, she needs to make a call, to one of her colleagues. She knows that most of her doctor friends are likely dead asleep at this hour...except for one. Doctor Yaun Lan, a Chinese immigrant living in one of the towns just outside the Tokyo Metro. She knew he'd have something to help her, as some of the medicine he creates makes Takemi's stuff look like Children's Tylenol!

Regarding the Call, Takemi decided to...
1233122.title: Can't Get No...Satisfaction

choices: Don't waste any time, lots of lines on the way to Machida, better get moving.
On second thought, get some breakfast before departing, she knows a great diner!
12331221.content:
Takemi decided its would better to attempt to set up her appointment with Dr. Lan for the morning, just to potentially make things easier for the both of them. Even if it was currently 3AM, Takemi knew that the old bat would never be asleep at this hour. Not because he would have customers this late, but because Dr. Lan was both too dedicated to making medicine and also a little paranoid...that didn't stop him from being an outstanding doctor, even at his age, so Takemi know he'd have just the right thing to ease her...troubles.

After some time searching for Dr. Lan's number in her contact book, she finds it, thankful she's kept it after all these years. Takemi also feels lucky that she still has her landline, as she doubts Dr. Lan has a cellphone...Regardless, she splashes some cold water on her face to wake herself up and proceeds to dial.

After a few rings, she's sent to voicemail! Frustrated, Takemi calls again....voicemail again! Maybe he really was asleep...or dead. She really hopes he's not dead. After several rings on the 3rd call, the old loon finally picks up. A hoarse voice can be heard on the other line.

"Hello? HELLO?", shouted Dr. Lan, baffled by the insistent calling, "Who are you and why are you calling me at 3 in the morning?!"
"Hmm, Yes, Dr. Lan, this is...um, Doctor Tae Takemi. I was wanted to call you to-" "WHO?!", Takemi being interrupted by the old fossil.
"Dr Tae Takemi...I collaborated with you 6 years ago on a special blend of medicine, you don't remember?" "Ohhhh...Tae-chan! Yes, I remember now! Such a sweet girl, how have you been? I heard what happened with your director, such a shame, that...are you still managing well in Yongen though?" "Yes, yes, I've been holding up quite well...thank you for your concern, Dr Lan...however, that's not the reason I called you, especially at this hour..."

"Oh?", Dr. Lan's interest was piqued, "If not to check in on a codger like me, then what other reason could you have?"
"Well", Takemi explained with slight apprehension, "I wanted to inquire about buying some medicine from you..." "MEDICINE?!" Lan exclaimed. "Why would you need medicine from me? You're able to synthesize quite well for yourself, no need to buy off me! You know, as doctors, we're obligated to look after ourselves as much as we do our patients, so there's nothing wrong with-" That's...what I wanted to discuss with you, Dr. Lan...in person. You see, now that it's Flu Season, my clinic has been busier than ever and I...just can't keep up this year. I never have time to unwind, take a breaker. I especially have trouble...tsk" Takemi clicked her tongue in embarrassment, "trouble...getting off."

"...Getting off where?", Dr. Lan asked, "Getting off the Subway platform? Oh, I know the feeling! I can not tell you how many times I've almost-"
"I meant masturbation...Dr. Lan. I am having trouble...pleasing myself." "Oh...well, If I may be reminded...how old are you, Tae-chan?" "I'm 34", Takami shamefully said. "34...Well, if a women your age is already having nerve degradation in that area, this could proving troubling if left alone.." Yes...it would..."
"However!", Dr Lan, exclaimed, "You are not the first women your age who has called me for such troubles, and doubtless will you be the last. I have just the medicine for you!" "Really....you do?!", Takemi shouted, "How much will it cost?" "A mere 10,000 yen. I can pencil you in to meet me around 2PM tomorrow, at the earliest...now, you remember where my office is, do you not?" "Yes, I believe it was somewhere in Machida...quite far from Shibuya, but if I head out early enough, I should be there some time in the afternoon!"

""Good, good...and if you're somewhat late, do not worry. I am able to wait any length of time to be visited by a promising young doctor like yourself. Now, if that's all you had to discuss, then you need to rest right away. You have a big day tomorrow, Tae-chan." "Yes", Takemi said, relieved, "I will. Thank for your time, Dr. Lan." The two doctor's roundabout conversation ended on a high note...Takemi could barely believe it. She needed to get to bed right away.

Awaking at 6 AM, Takemi had to start her day quickly. She put a "Closed" sign on her clinic and made her way to the subway line. After exiting the main Shibuya line and making her way through the Station, Takemi had a few options to consider. She could be punctual and make her way toward Machida right away...then again, she hadn't had her breakfast or coffee, as she forgot to stop at Leblanc in her rush.

Takemi decides on a course of action. She decides to:
12331221.title: Midnight Medicine Dealing

choices: Takemi arrives at Lan's clinic, ready to conduct business.
123312212.content:
Takemi had plenty of time to start her numerous series of transfers on the way to Machida...besides, its only 7 AM and she's yet to have any breakfast at all. Like Dr. Lan said, as a doctor, it's her duty to look after herself just as much as she does her patience, and going on a 5 hour+ journey with no breakfast wasn't going to do her any favors.

With breakfast on the brain, Takemi decided to take a bit of a detour to Shinjuku...she'd heard of a wonderful diner that had opened up a few months ago, though she never had the free time till now to go check the place out. She'd heard they even bake their own breads and pastries on site, in the diner! Thinking about it got a very loud rumble out of her stomach.

By the time Takemi got there around 8:10, she was surprised to see that she didn't have to wait in line to get a table...usually, on any weekend, diners like this one were packed before 10! Still, Takemi was never one to look a gift horse in the mouth and was quickly seated in a booth.

The sheer selection of buttery, creamy and fruity goods elicited yet another grumble from her tumble...having experienced this, Takemi didn't take long to order.

As her appetizer, Takemi started off with a Raspberry/Orange parfait, red and orange chunks of fruit, floating in a sea of cream...a wonderfully sweet and creamy tasting treat that delighted her pallet before her main breakfast course arrived.

Nothing said breakfast like Pancakes, and Takemi had ordered the House Special: the Blueberry Explosion Double Stack Pancakes! Each flapjack had to have at least 2 dozen Blueberries cooked into the pancakes and there were Four of these monstrous discs on her plate...Takemi dug right in, not needing even a drop of syrup to go with her hardy meal. After all, she didn't want to risk getting any sticky syrup on her outfit.

After only 7 minutes, Takemi had eaten every single one of those berry-lescious pancakes. Needless to say, she was stuffed and read for her trip.
After paying a surprisingly modest sum, less than what Dr. Lan is charging for her custom medicine, Takemi was back in track and on her way to Machida...thankfully with all those pancakes in her, it was easy to take short naps before she had to go out and transfer. And better she nap now than later, as she is going to have do quite a bit of walking for the first few of these transfers...

After 4 other Transfers, she was finally on her last train, head right for the modestly sized city of Machida...At around 1:20 PM, Takemi got off the train at one of 2 lines in the fair city and made her way in. She ordered an Uber for the remaining distance on the way to Dr. Lan's clinic.
123312212.title: Breakfast Before the Blues

choices: She had to try the Pills out now, right now!
She decided to prepare a warm bath first...
1233122121.content:
As her Uber Cab drove down the narrow road, Takemi saw the tiny clinic of Dr. Lan outside the car's window, a small neon sign that spelled out the Chinese character for "Health", no longer glowing, having gone out years ago.

As she exited the car and tipped her driver, she approached the door to the clinic, knocking 3 or 4 times. She waits several minutes, hearing Dr. Lan's voice on the other side. "Just a moment, I'll be right with you!", he heard him yell, then hearing many loud metallic clangs and bangs, like something you'd hear in an old cartoon.

Takemi was starting to lose her patience somewhat...She had come all this way to get a solution for her problem, she's not about to be kept waiting any longer! She knocked on the door once more, with a much harder impact. "Old bat was sure to hear that one", Takemi thought.

Finally, Doctor Yaun Lan finally opened the door, a small, pruned old man, no taller than 5 feet, wide smile on his face looked up to greet his fellow Doctor Tae Takemi, hoping to see a smile on her in return...but her only received a small frown from the much taller and much younger Doctor. This had him taken aback, causing him to remark, "Tae-chan...so...nice to see you. Please, come in. I, uh...like what you've done with your hair. The eye make-up seems like a little much, however...".

Takemi, paying no heed to the old man's comment on her style, walked right past him and into the clinic, sitting on a chair in the waiting area. She spotted many magazines spread messily across an end table next to her...almost all of them were horribly outdated, the newest of the selection was from 2002! At this point, Takemi had thought, in hindsight, maybe it would have been better to have ordered Dr. Lan's Medicine by mail...but he likely would have screwed that up too.

Dr Lan had taken several minutes, but he had returned from the back of the clinic, bag in hand, prescription note on the bag. The packaging on the bag looked very nice, colorful even, which was surprising considering the state of everything else in the this clinic, the Doctor included.

"Alright then, Tae-chan, I've got your special medicine right here! There are enough pills in this package to last you, eeeeh, about 2 months? Give or take, depending on how often you, ahem, need to relieve stress, so to speak.", Dr. Lan remarked sheepishly, as he continued, "Now I'm going to need you to sign here...and here. And there, you should be right as rain!", he said, handing Takemi the bag. "Thank you, Dr. Lan...now, I suspect you only take cash as payment for your medicine?"

"Oh, Tae-chan, you know me so well!", Dr. Lan laughed. "No", Takemi said dryly as she exchanged the 10,000 Yen, "I really don't."
"So, with that all taken care of, can I go now?", Takemi asked, "I have my own clinic to get back to."

"Yes yes, you are free to leave, it was nice seeing you again, Tae-chan...oh! Wait! I almost forgot, be sure to not consume any amount of Vitamin C before taking one of the pills! It could interfere with-" Dr. Lan's disclaimer fell on deaf ears, as the door to his clinic had just swung shut, hearing the faint clack of Takemi's heels on the concrete outside. And so he was, left alone in his clinic once again...Dr. Lan could hoped that Tae Takemi would be alright. Such a promising young doctor had already been through too much in her career.

After many more hours and the same amount of walking and line transfers, Takemi had at long last made it back to her apartment...it was a long trip, both too and from, but it was all going to be worth it. Dr. Lan may have been a cooky old bat, but Takemi knew that he made some gooooood medicine!

She was giddy with anticipation to give the pills a whirl, so much so that she felt her own common decency was the only thing stopping her from popping open the bottle on the train ride and going to town right there!

As she made herself comfortable, Takemi soon decided that...

131232.content:
*Gggggrrrrrroooowwwwlllll* Shiho blush in embarrassment. She patted her stomach, in a calming motion. “I guess it has been awhile since I ate. Volleyball practice did work me out a lot harder than normal today.” Shiho ignores her pleading stomach and was make her way to the bookstore.

The wind blew and Shiho shivers. She rolls down her beige sweater sleeves in order to keep herself warm. Winter is getting closer. Soon, Shiho is going need to buy a jacket. Perhaps Ann would be able to join her next time and then they can both pick out each other’s jackets. Red naturally works the best on Ann.

Shiho’s stomach growled louder, and being mean, causing her a bit of hunger pain right as Shiho reached the doors. Shiho bit her lip. Maybe she can stop by here on the way back. She won’t be long.

Shiho head further down Central Street. She was about to turn into the Diner but stopped when she notice a big sign in front of the stairs. “We are sorry to inform you but the kitchen is currently being renovated due to compilations. We are still open and are serving beverages.”

*Growl.* Shiho groan. She can’t satisfy her stomach with coffee. Shiho continues down the street to find Big Bang Burger. Shiho frown. She doesn’t like this place. She would much rather go somewhere else. But this is the only place she could go that is near the bookstore. Shiho rocked back and forth on her feet before entering in.

The Big Bang Burger worker looked up from her cash register and noticed Shiho. “Hello, welcome to Big Bang Burger. How many I help you?” The Burger worker girl said politely.

Shiho cranked her head up, effectively pushing her chest out more noticeably , looking at her options. They are all... greasy. Shiho never liked this kind of food. How could Ann happily eat one is beyond her.

Shiho looked back at the Burger worker. “Do you have anything else?” Shiho said. Probably no but it doesn’t hurt to ask.

“What do you mean?” The Burger worker asked politely. Now that Shiho got a better look at the Burger girl, she notice the worker looks... a little too good looking. Very attractive. Big breasts (bigger than Shiho’s), thin waist, wide hips and a nice smile. Shiho imagine a person with those looks wouldn’t take their job at a fast food style restaurant seriously. But she is, waiting patiently and politely for Shiho’s response.

Realizing she is staring, Shiho collected herself, blushing shyly. “I-I mean, do you have anything non-greasy? Something “healthier” I can eat.” Ann teases her sometimes for being a picky eater, poking Shiho’s stomach when they go out to eat. Shiho can’t help it, she doesn’t trust food to not have a negative effect on her.

The Burger girl demeanor got a little serious. “May I ask where our “healthier” options are?”

“Um,” Shiho is getting a little confused, “From a side menu.”

As if Shiho said a code word, the burger girl got polite again, but she seemed a little excited. “Please sit at the table in the back, Miss. I’ll bring the side menu shortly.”

Shiho did as the Burger girl said and sat at the table. She looked around the restaurant. Nobody else is here. Weird but not unusual. One time, Ann and Shiho gets the diner to themselves for 15 minutes. It can happen.

Shiho didn’t have to wait long. The Burger girl came out, carrying a large menu. “Here you go, Miss. Our selection for newcomers.”

Shiho grabs the menu. The menu even has pictures next to the names. She looks it over. Ōkina mune, which is a veggie burger. Ōkina o shiri, which seems to have quality meats. Ōgazumu, seems to have fish. And lastly, Taijū no zōka seems to have the combination of all 3. Looking over the price, they don’t seem that expensive. Though, Shiho has never heard of any of them before.

“Are these...?” Shiho began to ask.

The Burger girl understood what she was asking. “Yes, our private options. We are hoping that they are to your liking.” The Burger girl seems misinformed that Shiho knew about the special menu before hand. But Shiho isn’t going to pass up on the opportunity. Maybe she’ll like these new foods.

“I would like the Ōkina mune, please.” The other three are not an option. Shiho is trying not to her breasts any bigger than they already are.

The Burger girl nodded. “Alright miss. Are you eating it for here or to go?”

info.brief_description: The girls of the massively popular Persona 5 begin to grow in various ways.
info.description:
Seeing as Persona 4 has an interactive story about its girls growing in various ways, why shouldn't Persona 5 have one too?

Rules

1- Nothing too strange please. You know what I'm talking about.

2- Additions must be at least one paragraph long. A chapter that only has one sentence will be deleted (There are exceptions to this rule like making an addition for a new character's route and how they should grow.)

3- Stay in character as much as possible. There are exceptions, such as the character enjoying the growth even though personality-wise they shouldn't, but you can't have an exceedingly nice character like Haru suddenly acting like a jerk.

4- There isn't any limits to how big the girls can get other than your imagination.

5- No scripts.

6- Only the girls are allowed to grow.

7- I'll allow sex but no Justine, Caroline, and the spoiler character having sex.

8- Let's keep the story light, okay? Absolutely no killing off characters or extremely dark plots.

9- Any further rules will be added if they come up.

Now, thank you to anyone who adds a chapter. Let's go and make the amazing girls of Persona 5 grow as much as possible!
